features.name: Example feature
features.description: Just included to outline the responses supported by the page
Define gradient mesh paint servers to define two-dimensional gradients with arbitrary shapes.

features.name: <mesh> element
features.description: Draws a path-like shape that tightly fits a mesh gradient and is filled with it.

features.name: <hatch> element
features.description: Define a hatch paint server, which draws a repeating pattern of paths that are continuous in one dimension and tiled in the other.

features.name: <video> HTML embedded content element
features.description: Selected HTML embedded content elements (<video>, <audio>, <canvas>, <iframe>) can now be embedded direcly in SVG without requiring a <foreignObject> wrapper

features.name: <audio> HTML embedded content element
features.description: Selected HTML embedded content elements (<video>, <audio>, <canvas>, <iframe>) can now be embedded direcly in SVG without requiring a <foreignObject> wrapper

features.name: <canvas> HTML embedded content element
features.description: Selected HTML embedded content elements (<video>, <audio>, <canvas>, <iframe>) can now be embedded direcly in SVG without requiring a <foreignObject> wrapper

features.name: <iframe> HTML embedded content element
features.description: Selected HTML embedded content elements (<video>, <audio>, <canvas>, <iframe>) can now be embedded direcly in SVG without requiring a <foreignObject> wrapper

features.name: <base> HTML metadata element
features.description: Selected HTML metadata elements ('base', 'link', 'meta', <style>, and <script>) can be included within the SVG fragment and have their normal effect (but except for linked stylesheets, user agents are only required to support them if they already support HTML)

features.name: <link> HTML metadata element
features.description: Selected HTML metadata elements ('base', 'link', 'meta', <style>, and <script>) can be included within the SVG fragment and have their normal effect (but except for linked stylesheets, user agents are only required to support them if they already support HTML)

features.name: <meta> HTML metadata element
features.description: Selected HTML metadata elements ('base', 'link', 'meta', <style>, and <script>) can be included within the SVG fragment and have their normal effect (but except for linked stylesheets, user agents are only required to support them if they already support HTML)

features.name: <style> HTML metadata element
features.description: Selected HTML metadata elements ('base', 'link', 'meta', <style>, and <script>) can be included within the SVG fragment and have their normal effect (but except for linked stylesheets, user agents are only required to support them if they already support HTML)

features.name: <script> HTML metadata element
features.description: Selected HTML metadata elements ('base', 'link', 'meta', <style>, and <script>) can be included within the SVG fragment and have their normal effect (but except for linked stylesheets, user agents are only required to support them if they already support HTML)

features.name: role and WAI-ARIA state & property attributes on all elements
fr on radialGradient
features.description: Allows control of the radius of focal circle

features.name: refX and refY on <symbol>
features.description: supports more precise placement in maps and data charts

features.name: x,y,width, and height on <symbol> (as presentation attributes)
zoomAndPan attribute on svg and <view> elements
Allow 'custom data attributes' on all elements.

svg2_categories.category: Geometric attributes that can now be specified as style properties

features.name: x, y, width and height on <svg>, <rect>, <image>, <foreignObject>, <use>, and <symbol>

svg2_categories.category: New values for existing properties or attributes

features.name: context-fill and context-stroke values for fill and stroke.
'child' and `child(_n_)` referencences instead of `url()` references for paint servers and markers.
auto-start-reverse value for the orient attribute of the marker element
features.description: This allows the same arrow marker to be used at the start and end of a line, automatically transformed to point in opposite directions.

features.name: Closepath commands Z and z fill in missing path data
Use canonical equivalent path for all basic shapes
features.description: Used in stroke dashing and marker positioning.

features.name: inline-size property
features.description: Enables auto wrapped text.

features.name: shape-inside property
features.description: Support text in a shape.

features.name: shape-subtract property
features.description: Support text in a shape.

features.name: shape-image-threshold property
features.description: Support text in a shape.

features.name: shape-padding property
features.description: Support text in a shape.

features.name: shape-margin property
features.description: Support text in a shape.

features.name: CSS font feature support (alternative glyphs, font-variant, etc.)
Masks, filters, and other graphics effects applied to <tspan> and <textPath> elements
Properties for auto wrapped text (text-indent, line-break, word-break, hyphens, word-wrap, overflow-wrap)
Vertical text and alternative text baseline properties from CSS
Support external use references with CORS and processing restrictions as spec'd
Implement <use> element as an inspectable shadow tree
Support event re-targetting for event bubbling and related methods
Use shadow DOM style-matching rules & clone stylesheets from external files
Clone animations associated with cloned elements
scroll bars when overflow property is scroll on <svg> elements
'clip' and overflow not ignored when SVG document referenced via <image>
Replace SVG-specific events with common equivalents

svg2_categories.category: Other new behaviour or visual changes

features.name: <unknown> elements are treated as a <g> or <tspan> element
<script> element in content model of all elements
'animation elements' in content model of <view> element
<svg> as children of HTML or <foreignObject> elements no longer overflow hidden by default
<foreignObject> elements no longer overflow hidden by default
New guidance on resolving URLs and loading external files
Conditional processing attributes and switch only affect the display of the relevant elements, not processing of styles, scripts, or fetching of external resources.
Clearer guidance given on the intrinsic sizing of SVG elements when embedded in other layout systems
Bounding boxes for objects with no position are at (0,0)
Provide both declarative (tabindex) and scripted control over which elements receive keyboard focus, allowing the creation of keyboard-accessible widgets, in a manner consistent with HTML.
Allow 'WAI-ARIA attributes' (role and also state and property attributes) on all elements.
Define default and allowed role values for each element.
Ordering of 'systemLanguage' preferences follows SMIL allowReorder definition
Allow alternative text metadata (<title> and <desc>) to be provided in multiple language versions in the same file.

Support for non-Western writing modes is now harmonized with CSS, which should lead to wider and more consistent implementations; includes support for additional vertical writing modes compared to SVG 1.1.
Add additional attributes to the <a> element to synchronise with HTML
Focus control uses the same model as HTML ('tabindex' attribute, focus() and blur() methods)
HTML <link> element supported and must load external style sheets; other HTML metadata supported
Use CSS parsing rules for all presentation attributes and many other attributes
white space character set now includes form feed (U+000C) to align with HTML and CSS
Support percentages and CSS lengths in many places
Elements that are never rendered are now defined in terms of user agent stylesheets
Required support for all pseudo-classes defined in CSS 2.1
Required support for ::first-line and ::first-letter pseudo-elements, and for ::selection in interactive user agents
Zero length sub-paths render result based on stroke-linecap value
Remove baseProfile and version attributes from the <svg> element
Remove the viewTarget attribute from the <view> element
SVGUnknownElement interface
features.description: For unrecognized markup in the SVG namespace.

features.name: SVGUseElementShadowRoot interface
features.description: An extension of the ShadowRoot interface.

features.name: ShadowAnimation interface
features.description: Defines a read-only clone of a WAAPI animation for use-element shadow trees.

features.name: length attribute and indexed property access for all list interfaces.
Moved members from SVGStylable and SVGLangSpace to SVGElement and removed those interfaces
Moved members from SVGLocatable and SVGTransformable to SVGGraphicsElement and removed those interfaces
focus() and blur() methods on SVGElement
features.description: Related to tabindex attribute

features.name: SVGElement now inherits GlobalEventHandlers from HTML
Remove xml:base, xml:lang, and xml:space attributes from SVGElement interface
Make animVal an alias for baseVal and no longer reflect animated value
SVGElement has been extended to replace the core functionality from SVGElementInstance.
Remove methods on SVGPathElement related to SVGPathSeg* and SVGAnimatedPathData
animatedPoints attribute of SVGAnimatedPoints now aliases the points attribute
Replace SVG-specific events with common equivalents
